enb_long_title: Twenty-Fourth sessions of the Subsidiary Body for Scientific and Technological Advice (SBSTA) and the Subsidiary Body for Implementation (SBI) of the UNFCCC and First session of the Ad Hoc Working Group on Further Commitments for Annex I Parties under the Kyoto Protocol (AWG) and related meetings
sentences: Parties exchanged views on the work of the CGE, compilation and synthesis of initial national communications, and the provision of financial and technical support.
Several parties suggested that a seventh compilation document was not necessary.

One developed country said the Secretariat could go a step further and analyze communications, however developing countries disagreed, saying the focus should be on obstacles to the preparation of communications.
